The common thread is: Sidney Crosby makes his team better. Even in what for most players would be a lost season, Crosby has played only 12 games, but has 19 assists on the season (plus 2 goals) and is +14.Â
It can be said that he's underpaid for the value and intangibles he brings to the Penguins...and he deserves that "C" on his jersey. The only problem with Sid: you can't predict concussions. That said, the real Headache for the Pens will be after the 2012-13 season when Crosby (and teammate Evgeni Malkin) both become pre-age 27 UFAs.Â
But in the present, even though I see the Rangers holding Off the Pens for the top seed in the Eastern Conference, it can be argued that the Pens, with two weapons scoring at better than a point-a-game, and Crosby making bottom-6 linemates that much better, that the Pens should now be the favorites to come out of the East. Sid's a guy who can play on any line, first through fourth, and improve the play of his linemates and score.Â
Yes he will have detractors whenever he is seen as embellishing a hit, but that aside, he's the symbol of today's NHL. 593 points in 424 regular-season games and another 82 points in 62 playoff games will do that.
